reviewText: This is a basic lightweight cork board that seems it will hold up well to gentle home use. The black frame is plastic but not unattractive and should be fine most anywhere you'd want a plain cork board. Given that the self-adhesive strips are described as permanent I'm a little concerned about wall damage when it's time to remove, but I haven't tested their removability since they're one-time use. Just note the word "permanent" and be ready to hang another way if that's a problem.

Really enjoying this corkboard. I find it to be durable and attractive. I have a cluttered office and I really enjoy being able to put things of urgency on this board. I think you will find this to be a good fit for your office needs.

The cork is of good quality, small grain size so you shouldn't have any issues sticking things on. The small plastic frame is unobtrusive, and it comes with some pads to stick it on the wall. I could complain that the pads are not the temporary "command hook" style holders but permanent stickers, but I think that's unnecessary. If you need other hanging solutions, go get one, this is a fine board.

Currently at 13 bucks is too much.  There are 4-5 star options for less. Even this brand, Quartet, has a cheaper better quality board with a wood frame.But if you want something very thin, lightweight with a cheap "silver" (color, not metal) plastic frame, it's fine.There is no mounting hardware, just some 3M sticky pads to peel and stick. So there is no hook or way to hang it unless you want the foam stickers on your wall.  The back is thin, so you can't nail in your own hardware.  I tried stapling string on the back, but it is not secure.  So your only option is to use the stickers.You can only use basic tacks.  Push pins are just okay, and feel like they could pop through the back.  Drop the thing and it's history.  Under 10 bucks would be still pushing it.  Disposable at best. 3 stars is generous.

It's lightweight and easy to hang. I didn't use the included adhesive squares to hang it, because I haven't had good experience with those coming off cleanly. I used Command Strips and they worked fine.

This is a very nice size cork bulletin board, big enough to hang large items on as well as fitting many smaller post its or photos. The frame is sleek and attaches to the wall with sticky backed foam pieces, I opted to use command strips for easier removal and less wall damage. I wish that this came with at least a dozen or so push pins to allow immediate use instead of having to order them separately.

I could see the Quartet Cork Bulletin board being used in a dorm room by a college student, or for travel by someone who has to give presentations on the go. The price of this board and its overall sturdiness would have appeal to a college student and the fact that this board is extremely light would be a plus for the traveler who needs to make a presentation. This bulletin board has a plastic protective frame rather than the usual metal or wood frame; this is the main reason why the bulletin board is so light and probably is a factor in its low price also. Overall, I recommend this bulletin board for the above uses, but, if you have a little more money, there are other more attractive options to consider.
summary: the advantages of this Cork Bulletin are its price and its extremely light weight

reviewText: I find it difficult to wax eloquent about something this utilitarian, but I will just say: it works, it looks the way one expects it to look, and it does the required job, that of being a pin-pushable backdrop for reminders.

I have several of these in my home for a number of purposes. Some are heavy and sturdy and some are cheap and light.This one is definitely in the "cheap and light" category. The corners don't meet up evenly and the cork is very light and shows pin holes quickly.  For the price, I can get one at my local super store that is a bit nicer looking with a more decorative frame.Still, it's not bad if you just need something to "get the job done" and don't care much about aesthetics.The light weight is an asset if you want to use the included sticky tabs to fasten it to a wall or the side of a fridge securely so it won't be knocked down frequently.
summary: Just okay. Nothing fancy, nothing horrible.

reviewText: The quality is fine. The cork is uniform and thick enough to hold the pins without any problems. The plastic frame is simple, but it does what it needs to do. The only real problem with this is that the only mounting "hardware" included is permanent adhesive. It might be fine for some applications, but hanging brackets would have made much more sense. It is not even as simple and buying your own and using them, because there really is nowhere on the back to mount them.If you are comfortable with sticking this somewhere permanently, then it is a fine product.

This is a little thinner and lighter than other cork boards I've had, meaning that it kind of lifts off the wall if just attached at the top.  You definitely want to mount it firmly.  Once it's mounted, it's a nice size and looks good - holds up things!
summary: Thinner and lighter than I expected

reviewText: These days my memory isn't what it use to be and so I have started writing notes to myself to stay on track. However, piles of notes don't get my interest and I still forget, appointments, grocery lists and other scheduled events. I wanted a bulletin board but at the store they are VERY expensive and either too big or too small. That said, I was happy to get the Quartet Cork Bulletin Board, just the perfect size for my kitchen, light weight, easy to hang and at a price I can afford. Now at first glance I can see all my appointments, events and grocery list. Yes, it is truly a life saver.

Tacks and pushpins stay in.  The cork isn't sticky and weird.  The frame is simple and non-flashy which is quite suitable for an office basic like this one.Other reviewers already mentioned the tenacity of the self-stick hangers.  My board is stuck to my metal filing cabinet with magnets, so I haven't experienced any wrecked paint.  The board is light enough that the magnets hold it up just fine.I don't love it, but the board does what I need it to do at work.  That deserves 4 stars.  I don't need my bulletin board to be romantic or heavy-duty, so I'm happy with this one.
summary: Very, very, very basic.  But I'm okay with that in a bulletin board.

reviewText: I've been wanting a bulletin board for the wall behind my home office desk chair for quite awhile.  The pictures in the room all have slender, vertical black metal frames so, when offered this vertical cork bulletin board with a black frame, I went for it.This frame is plastic and instead of meeting unobtrusively in the corners, the pieces meet about an inch away from the corners, with seams that are very noticeable; also, the vertical and horizontal pieces are of different widths. I could probably live with that. But a bulletin board that must be affixed to the wall with "permanent self-stick pads" that other reviewers here note would pull the paint off the wall along with it were I to move or remove it? That I won't do.I'm giving some thought to taking this to a framer who might be able to salvage the cork and put it in a slender black metal frame with a backing that won't pull the paint off the wall. If that works, and doesn't cost a whole lot,  I'll come back here and add a third star.
summary: I guess you could call this an "off the wall" review

reviewText: All cork boards aren’t created equal.  This one is definitely not a superior board; in fact, flimsy is the word that best describes it.  You can’t use it to hang jewelry on because the board can’t support the weight as the push pins are minimally supported by the thin cork. You can’t use it to secure multiple pages such as policies for the office. However, you could use it to secure single page memos and such.  The trick is to hang things that aren’t weighty.  My recommendation is to skip this one for one with better grade of cork and more substantial frame (this one is plastic). Yeah “you get what you pay for” but there should be more pride in the production of a product that carries your name. I say shame on the manufacturers of this product.
summary: Put a cork in the production of this board

reviewText: If you are looking for a cork board within the constraints of a very limited budget, this may be the product for you.  The "frame" is nothing but a plastic channel which is crudely adjoined at the corners.  The cork is quite thin, but will definitely hold a push pin [not included].  The entire board weighs next to nothing, which makes it simple to hang.  However, the fasteners included are PERMANENT double-edged tape.  For $14, and considering the BASIC quality of the materials used to manufacture this cork board, I honestly think Quartet could have afforded to provide a couple of 3M Command Strips.  I used a level to mark the wall where I wanted to hang the board.  I tried my very best to hang the board squarely on the line I had drawn, yet I was a little off and the board hangs slightly crooked.  TOO BAD.  There is NO WAY to adjust or remove the board now.  Actually, I am expecting that if I ever do want to remove the board, the wall paint is going to come along with it.  In this day and age, I think it is rather ridiculous that Quartet provided PERMANENT double-edged tape to mount this product.  I am now regretting using it.  I should have just purchased my own Command strips.  But, I was anxious to get the board hung, so I acted impulsively.  If you decide to order this product, I suggest you have Command strips on hand and completely discard the permanent tape included.  The board does the job.  It is just important to note that it is extremely basic.  It think it may be a good buy for the budget-conscious.

The Quartet Cork Bulletin Board, 17 x 23 Inches, Black Frame (MHOB1723-BK) is a nice cork board. It is important that you have it completely level before sticking to your wall. Also, be sure that wherever you hang it is where you want it to stay. Removing the board may take part of your wall depending on the surface that you stick it to. The good news is that it stays in place very well.

Quartet Cork Bulletin Board, 17 x 23 Inches, Black Frame, is a great light weight bulletin board. I love it. Well, except hanging it with double sided adhesive pads. I rigged some picture hanging hardware with a wire going from side to side so I could hang it where I want it now and easily move it if I'm rearranging things or moving. While the adhesive pads can be removed with some rubber cement thinner or lighter fluid, I don't want to do that.A basic, functional bulletin board that allows me to get stuff laying around on my drawerless desk off of it while keeping the stuff handy. It's a great place to put post-its, some photos to brighten your day, and all those urgent messages I keep "forgetting" to return.

I picked this for review because I needed a cork board. I had missed out on grocery discounts because the coupons expired. Now that they're tacked to this board, it's harder to miss them.Like other inexpensive Quartet products, the frame is plastic, not metal ("silver frame" notwithstanding). The manufacturer seems to think "gray" equates to silver. And for something mostly plastic, it strikes me as on the pricey side. (Quartet's oak-finish board is larger -- and costs less.)I have two gripes. One is that no pushpins are supplied. (I have some, but you'd think ACCO would include a dozen.) The other is that the only way to mount the board is with the supplied double-sided (and non-repositionable) adhesive pads. This is okay, only if you never move the board. I was hoping for rings, so the board could be hung with nails or (better) those 3M removable hooks.Not a bad product, but hardly one to get you jumping with excitement. It's serviceable.

I've had a white board on the side of my refrigerator for years. Not the same one, as they do tend to fall apart after a time, and most of them have been just a little too large.This one is a nice size, big enough for multiple entries, small enough that it doesn't get in the way. It does appear to be quite well made, moreso than others I've had over the years.

Nice to have a color frame on a whiteboard! It's very cute, and just the right size (the same as regular letter size paper) for mounting on a fridge or a small wall space. It comes with magnetic strips you can attach to the whiteboard for mounting on a refrigerator. The board itself is magnetic, and a couple of magnets to hold paper memos or notes included, along with a dry-erase marker with a built-in eraser.The red color is a shade toward the burgundy side, just so you know.

This dry-erase board came with magnets, and I was going to use it on my fridge for a daily caper/chore chart.  However, using all the materials in the package, the magnets are not strong enough to stay on the fridge; the board keeps sliding down the side of the fridge.  I'm less than impressed as I don't have another good place to put it, and I'd have to install picture frame hardware to get it on the wall.  It does stay if the marker and clip and magnets are all off, but just barely.  So, this is okay if you have another place to put those items, like the top of the fridge, but it doesn't live up to all expectations.

White boards have become synonymous with thinking, planning, collecting thoughts for later organization. I have had a white board in every office I've occupied in the last 20 years because they help me visualize my projects, communicate to others and jot down random thoughts I need to remember.This Quartet board is the smallest I have ever worked with before and initially, I thought it would only be good for grocery lists. You know - you run out of peanut butter and napkins, so you write it down so you remember to get those things on your next grocery shopping trip. In "portrait" mode, this board is about right for two columns of about 10 items per column, so perfect for that kind of use.But I actually ended up using this petite board in my home office instead. It is too small to map out project plans, but perfect for- listing my "Gotta Do Today" projects- quickly recording "Don't Forget You Promised" items- moving around - from desk to planning table. I can use it to take quick notes while on a conference call, then carry it to another room to spread out my work papers and finish a project.I have used enough white boards to know that quality varies - some are so cheaply made that you can't cleanly erase text that has been left on the board too long. This one seems high quality - smooth surface and easy to clean. It comes with a small black dry erase pen and a clip that it slides into. It also comes with two magnets that I don't use - but you could hold a paper note to the board with the magnet if you roll that way. The plastic frame surrounding the board is an ugly avocado green that goes with... well, practically nothing, but it isn't distracting. The board quality is OK - the back of the board is cheap cardboard, so I don't know how long this will last. It doesn't come with any way to hang the board, but its small size means that you can put it just about anywhere - as long as it has a surface to stand on.Overall, this is a very handy size for my work and the quality of the writing surface is fine.

I remember years ago when I wanted a write on magnetic board I had to search and finally paid a large amount at an office supply store for a very nice, heavy board.  I still have it and it is still in good shape.This small board is light weight and convenient to move around to where I need it.  It is white, comes with a clever pen that has an eraser on the end, and a couple of magnets.  It erases nicely and the magnets are sturdy firm.I have not tried to hang it on the wall, but the hanger doesn't appear to be very sturdy.  I have no idea how well made this is or how long it will last, but it is fine for now.

I needed a smaller portable dry erase board for my math classes that I teach.  This is large enough for my small group to see, but not so big that isn't cumbersome to carry.  I ordered extra markers in difference colors.  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is that the trim has as unsightly seam that is destined to break apart like all of the other 11 x 14 boards I've had with this same design.

his is a good sized message board, not too large.The marker with the attached dry eraser is pretty nice. Handy.The clear magnets are great for attaching appointment cards or grocery lists, etc.I don't care for the provided means of securing it to a wall or refrigerator because for me it will not stick well enough.I'll get a mount at the hardware shop so I can fasten it to a wall with a better, firmer grip.

It's pretty much one of those products that you expect to get what you pay for.  At this price point, <$7, I don't think you can expect metal brackets, screws, and ledges.  It's not meant to be permanent, more convenient and disposable.  As such, it'd be perfect for college dorms and such.  It mounts with sticky tape and we use ours for grocery lists.  The 2 included magnets are handy too.

Big enough to allow for comfortable writing and full messages, but small enough to fit almost anywhere, this is an excellent size. The clip on top for the marker is a huge bonus, since I can never manage to keep them neatly on the trays that some other versions of whiteboards have. Came with two magnets, which seems appropriate for the size.Best part was the pre-cut magnets and sticky tape perfectly sized to fit the flat corner squares on the back - peel, stick, and mount in literally seconds. No fuss, no other supplies needed.

reviewerName: But I'm feeling much better now...
reviewText: I've been using this on my refrigerator using the magnets provided, although it can be attached to a wall using the included Scotch sticky pads.  It's nice to be able to remove it and carry it to my desk.  This is actually magnetic in two ways, the magnets can stick it to a steel surface, and the small buttons also included can also be used to attach papers to the board.What I can't quite put my finger on, and why I deducted one star, is it just looks cheap.  Could be a bit more sturdy without the obvious seams that hold it together showing.However, it is a nice product and I plan on using it daily to get a bit more organized.
summary: Magnetic mounts are nice to take it down to write on.

reviewerName: B. Williams ""We must be the change we wi...
reviewText: My only qualm is that the magnets need  to be stronger,  As long as I have extra magnets on the refrigerator, it's fantastic! I leave notes there for things that need to be done. I also love the dry erase pen, which writes and erases!

The board feels very cheap--cardboard back and plastic frame but the worst part is that it won't stay on the wall. We use the adhesive strips and it keeps falling off. Very, very unhappy with this product.

At our house, we have always had a white board attached to our fridge to jot down grocery lists as we use the product. Our last one bit the dust and we got this one.As a white board, it is fine.  The marker is easy to use and the surface is smooth.  The red color frame was cute and very bright.The frame itself is flimsy and it is already falling off.  The four magnets on the back that hold it to the fridge seem to be weak.  We put a magnet in each corner but as we write on the board, it slides off the fridge.  Really, really annoying.

This white board is only okay.  It comes with 2 magnets as well as the marker with eraser on top.  The plastic is really flimsy and when I took the magnets off the board for the first time they left a sticky residue behind.  I am only semi-happy with this board.

This is a decent white board for the price. The frame is plastic, which betrays its cheapness, but it comes in attractive colors--mine is green--which is nice. The board comes with two magnets which can be used to affix items to the white board. Some of these Quartet magnets come with magnets that have a striped design. My board came with clear magnets, which are considerably less attractive than the striped magnets. Having this be a magnetic bulletin board is a nice touch, though I'm not sure yet if that will prove to be an important factor after continued use.The frame also comes with double sided tape and mounting magnets so that you can either affix the board to a wall or to a metal surface. To do the latter, you first position the tape on the back, then affix the magnets to the tape: the magnets themselves aren't sticky, in other words. I did not try hanging the board up on a wall, so I'm not sure whether that would hold well. But I did put the self-adhesive tape and magnets on the back and tried putting it up on my refrigerator. Unfortunately, the magnets weren't strong enough to hold the weight of the board, which slowly slid down the refrigerator door. It held a little more firmly--though not firmly enough--to the door of our dishwasher (the difference being, perhaps, that the refrigerator door is textured and the dishwasher door is smooth).So the two downsides of the board are the ugly magnets and the fact that the mounting magnets it comes with can't do the job of holding it up. The latter is the more important concern, but it's not a deal-breaker. In short, a good enough white board.

This board is great and the perfect size to fit on a fridge for shopping lists or notes. It is easy to put together and the magnets are a great addition for sticking paper notes to the board (especially if you don't have it on a magnetic fridge). The marker is easy to erase and writes cleanly.

I was looking for a new dry-erase board for the fridge, as our old one was dropped and cracked on the side.  I was thinking this would be perfect.There is some assembly required.  First double-sided tape, then the four magnets.  Alright, all put together, ready to hang...and it starts sliding down.  To be fair, I had the two included front magnets on the board, the marker attached by clip and A SINGLE 4x6" PHOTO under one of the magnets.  I guess that extra gram made the difference, because it started sliding down immediately.Deal breaker.  Right there.  On top of that, 8 1/2" x 11" is a bit on the smaller side.  Our old board was maybe 11x14, but even that little extra room made a huge difference.I guess it would be ok for a dorm, or if you're old writing on it, and not using the included magnets to hold anything up...

Let's take this in steps:1. Board Frame: it's red on the 11 inch sides, and gray on the 8 inch side, with that 1/2 inch being red. Look at the picture, that's how it looks. The frame clicks together, and then there are staples through the back into the actual board. It's sturdier than I expected, feels like it will work for write-on/wipe-off usage for classwork.How for classwork? If you take a dry-erase board like this, draw properly spaced lines with a ruler and a permanent marker, you have a great reusable practice tablet for learning letters. That's been great for kids, and great for learning foreign languages that use a different alphabet. (Or Aleph-bet, in my case.)Back to it:2. Magnets: there's two little disc-style magnets to hold stuff to the board. If you're using the board on a wall, they have plenty of sticky power for going through one layer of card stock, but they get iffy at 2 cards. If you're carrying the board around, I'd skip magneting anything to it--put them on the fridge, because they're good ones.3. Board surface (magnet): keep in mind, "Magnetic Dry-erase Board" means magnets stick to it, not that it is a magnet you can stick stuff to like paper clips. Not a big deal, but not perfectly clear in description.4. Board surface (Dry-erase): spotless white until somebody writes on it with a permanent marker (see above). It writes well, cleans well with simple wipe off. No complaints on it.5. Marker (included Black ReWritable): I want to like these, because I've got them in multiple colors, but I just don't. If you don't store it tip down, it dries and does not write well. The little eraser is less than effective. It's better than no marker, but it's not worth replacing it with one just like it.Overall, this is a great cubicle/desk message board or a fridge board. Obviously, if you're doing large-scale teaching, it's too small, but for tutoring in math or writing, it works pretty well.I'm satisfied with it, but there's nothing exceptional here to make it a 5-star board. It meets expectations well, and looks to be a good value for the budget.Just grab a better marker when the included one kicks the bucket.

This 8.5" by 11" dry erase board is basically a No-Frills magnetic dry erase board. I'm glad that they even make dry erase boards in this size because it's nice and portable. It's nice that it comes with 2 magnets and a dry erase marker included. As far as the build materials are concerned, I think they could've made it a little more resilient. The plus side is that it's very light since it's made from lightweight plastic and has a inner core of cardboard. Build materials aside, this dry erase board works well for what it is and is affordably price. I'd recommend it to anyone who needs a nice, usable, 'no frills' 8.5" x 11" dry erase board.

This dry wipe off board is for occassional use only.  You will also need to plan on purchasing your own dry erase marker, because the one that comes with it is already dried out.  Okay for light duty use.

This is an inexpensive board, so I wasn't expecting much in quality. But it turns out to be a very nice little board. Granted, it's plastic, but I wasn't expecting a fine wood frame! The magnets are nice, and very handy, and it came with a marker, too. I'm pleased with it for what I intend to use it for, which is at a wedding reception.

A nice simple white board.  The board comes with double sided adhesive strips.  We have it tacked right on the frig.  Great for notes and reminders.  The board comes with two little magnets that work well for tacking that shopping list.  We have magnetic clips that we use too.  Overall, a convenient size magnetic white board that is stylist and meets the need for reminders, notes....etc.

This is a great dry erase board, especially for the fridge.  The build of the board itself and the frame are very sturdy.  It looks like it will withstand being moved from place to place for years to come.  Only comes with a black marker, which works for some.  We will certainly be buying more colors for this creative household.  The magnets adhere with 3M adhesive, so I have no worries about the board ever falling.  Very useful product in for making lists and reminders and love the red!!

The parents in my class what to know what happened each day and it is so much easier now that the class helps me list off all we did and I can put it out where the parents need to sign out their child. Now it didn't stick to our walls ever though it seemed very sticky. But that worked out for me since now the class helps me list what we did. I think it would stick to a flatter surface. I love the magnets that came with it. Very strong and will hold that note I needed to get to a parent.

Nothing special, but a very functional board. It does the job. Light weight, easy to hang on the wall with a few clips. Using a normal dry erase pen and wipe for daily use. Works well and cleans well. Lot of times even expensive boards dont wipe clean and leave a lot of streaks and dry up hard. This one is holing up so far after a month of use. Would buy again once it wears off
I was looking forward to having a small dry erase board hang on my office wall. The surface of this board worked fine. However, it didn't stick to the wall with the supplies provided.

I really like this dry-erase board.  It is the perfect size for just above my desk where I can write up my daily to-do list or reminders.  The one thing I had a problem with is that I wanted to mount it on my material-covered cubicle wall and be able to move it if needed.  The double-stick tape would have worked well enough, but velcro was the better choice.  So I got some sticky-backed velcro and stuck it to the back of the board then easily mounted it on the material-covered cubicle wall.  Now I can move the board if I need to simply by pulling it off and the velcro is still there so that the board can be mounted again elsewhere or back in the same spot.The color accent is also a nice touch and the little magnets are great for sticking a quick note to the board as well.

No surprises here.  This is a dry-erase board that I find to be the perfect size for the kitchen wall or refrigerator.  The pen works fine, and the attachments for wall mounting work well.  I was slightly disappointed in the quality of the frame.  It seemed a little crude.
summary: A Good Size for the Kitchen

reviewText: Since Amazon groups the reviews of the different sizes together, I will sum up the two that I received.I planned to replace the old dry-erase board on my refrigerator with the 8.5x11 one of these, but was extremely disappointed.  Four pieces of 3M adhesive are included along with four thin magnets -- you can use just the adhesive alone to hang the board, or you can attach the magnets and hang it using them.Unfortunately, the magnets are not strong enough to actually hold the board.  This reason I wanted this was, as I said, to replace the extremely worn dry-erase board on my refrigerator.  We've had other dry-erase boards on the fridge and never had this problem.On top of the magnetic problem, it feels cheap overall.  The marker is tiny, though at least it does have an eraser.  However, the first time I wrote something on the board it did not complete erase without scrubbing it with a tissue.  I think the spots where the marker remained were where the magnets were attached when packaged, so maybe in time that will go away (though it is seriously poor package planning).The only positive is it is more magnetic than other dry-erase boards I've had, but it is useless to me since I cannot hang it on my fridge and it is just absolute junk.  Bottom line is, find another dry-erase board -- this one isn't worth the money (not even the current $5.62 price).I also got the larger dry-erase board but did not attempt to use the magnets with that one.  However, it feels just as cheap as the smaller one.  I highly doubt the magnets included would hold that one either, but I attached it to a door so I was unable to test it.  So far the adhesive is holding it firmly in place.

This board is the perfect size for my refrigerator. It shows the marker colors brightly, is easy to erase, and the markers write clearly on it. There are two little magnets that come with it, in case you feel the need to attach something to the board. They aren't terribly strong, but will be fine for the odd piece of paper you consider important enough to adorn your freezer door. I see no downsides to this product at all. The included marker is black and attaches to the top via a clip. I also have a set of dry-erase color markers that work very well with this board.  http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000E7D72C

This board has a good size to it and looks great. It is magnetic like it indicates in the description and the dry erase quality works great. I loved that it came with a way to hang it magnetically, and so I hung it on my refrigerator. It is perfect there, except it does not have quite the magnetic strength on the hanger to stay put, so it falls easily. The only other issue is the border, which is green looks cheap and the seams that hols it together are not mesh with each other.

I've used Quartet boards before, and you can't beat them for the price. If you just need a small board for the occasional note, this will do wonders.The included magnets are a nice touch, and are stronger than I'm accustomed to coming from Quartet. On my older boards the included magnets could hold a single sheet of paper, but these managed four with no slippage.The marker, while an improvement, is still subpar. It writes better than previous versions, and the eraser is thicker as well. It still streaks while erasing every now and then, however, and the clip to hold it does so only loosely.I can't say this about this particular board given the length of time I've had it, but prior Quartet boards tend to get grungy after a while, with dry-erase marks becoming permanent rather quickly. So if you intend this board for heavy use, you might want to step up to the next price level.

Very standard nothing fancy board to write notes.  It works well, but the magnets did not hold it well on our refrigerator, it would seem to be okay and then start to slide downward a couple of minutes later.  Wo we had to move it to the wall using the double backed tape.  I'm not sure if that was due to the magnets included or maybe the metal composition of the refrigerator???Regardless, handy little item to keep around any house, apartment or dorm room.

I got this specifically for leaving messages and notes for the family. It is the perfect size for that.If you are thinking of putting it on a refrigerator as is the mounting magnets are likely not strong enough by themselvesto hold it on the fridge. With the super strong and small rare earth magnets I might have thought they would usethose instead. I put ours on a interior wooden door using double sided tape; with that application I have had no issuersand it works perfectly as a message and note board.

I ended up using it as a magnetic bulletin board, but it is nice to have the option of using it as a dry erase board as well. It comes with some magnets and a marker. The marker includes and eraser. The marker does not write very well, but I had other dry erase markers available and they worked better, so it is not a problem with the board. With the better markers, it erased cleanly. The front magnets are reasonably strong. I mounted it with the double sided tape, which worked fine. I didn't try the magnetic mounting option. It is not a heavy duty product, but is a good value. I would rather have been sent the larger size to review. 8.5x11 is just too small.
summary: Nice. The 8.5x11 size is too small. I recommend the larger size.

reviewText: This is a great little board to mount unobtrusively on the backsplash of a kitchen counter. Ours is mounted in such a way that it is right above the phone, and hides the phone's connector cords. Because it's magnetic, we can place shopping lists-in-progress on the board, and with the handy dry-erase pen, we can write simple messages that immediately catch the eye. We recently replaced our old fridge with a stainless model, which won't take magnets, so needed a small all-purpose board like this. It's perfect for our use!
summary: Just the right size -- small but useful

reviewText: My wife and I put this up right away in our pantry for keeping track of what is needed the next time we go to the grocery store.  I know, it is not electronic and cannot get you on the internet, but it works very well.There are several ways of hanging this board on the wall or you may use the magnets which are included.  It has a pen and eraser so you may begin using it immediately.  The size is about a sheet of paper 8 1/2 by 11 inches.  It is plastic, but should last for a very long time.Sometimes low tech is the way to go!
summary: Wonderful Grocery List and Message Center

reviewerName: J. W. Kennedy "in statu uiae et meriti"
reviewText: 8 1/2 x 11 is the size of a standard sheet of paper.  I know exactly how big that is; nevertheless I was still surprised when I got the item, by how small it is.  Not a whole lot of space for writing notes.  But on the plus side, it will fit just about anywhere, which is great if you don't have a lot of empty wall space for a larger board.It comes with two mounting options:  in a little baggie there are four squares of double-sided foam adhesive, and four squares of single-sided sticky magnets.  These fit on flat plastic panels in the corners on the back of the board.  You can only choose one method.  Once you've applied the mounts, they are pretty much on there permanently.  I went with the foam, and stuck it to a wall because most of my magnetic surfaces are already dry-erase-marker-friendly.Also included are two round magnets for sticking papers to the board, and a black marker with a felt eraser in the cap.  The clip that holds the marker can be positioned anywhere around the frame, and has a bit of sticky foam so you can secure it in place when you've decided where you want it.  I recommend doing this _before_ mounting the board on a wall; you can't do it afterward without a lot of difficulty and a butterknife.

This board is used by my preschooler to practice drawing and handwriting.  It's easy to use, light weight, and big enough so he doesn't fill it up to quickly, get bored, and find something else to color on :-)  The quality is perfect for what I need it for.  It's nice for him that it's not boring silver or black like typically found in dry erase boards.

I'd rate it a 5 but the picture seems to give a more vibrant green than it really is. I'd say in this it sort of looks lime but in reality it is more of a dull-ish avocado color. This may not matter to some (most?) people but I personally was hoping it was more vibrant/lime like the picture. Other than the color it's a great board.
summary: Dull Avocado Green vs Vibrant Lime Green

reviewText: My family loves this board for the refrigerator. It comes with four sturdy magnets to adhere to the back of the board, and it holds up well. The pen is long-lasting and clear, and I love the eraser tip on the cap. The magnets that it comes with are super-strong. It's durable and high-qaulity - excellent product.

I love these boards. I hang them everywhere. This one is on my refrigerator. I was disappointed a bit in the color. It is more of a dull green than the bright green shown. The writing surface also moves around quite a bit in the frame and the magnets were tightly glued to the surface and were hard to remove. It also left behind a very sticky residue that does not wash off with soap and water. Goo Gone was used and now that area is not as shiny as the rest. Also the marker was completely dried out.
summary: Love this type of board but this one has some flaws.

reviewText: This is a nice high quality dry erase board with a writing surface the same size as a standard US sheet of paper (8.5 x 11).  The surface is magnetic and includes two small round magnets as well as additional magnets for mounting the board on a refrigerator.  A nice fine point dry erase marker is included and 3M (Command Center) hanging tabs for mounting the board on a standard wall.The board erases cleanly and writes very smooth.  It's the perfect size for a dorm room, kitchen, office or just to jot down notes or messages and carry around the house with you.Exactly what I needed! Highly recommended!
summary: Perfect small dry-erase with all hanging tools included

reviewText: What can you say about a white board?  The size of it seems to be perfectly suited to mounting on a fridge and it comes with a single black marker.  It is mounted on the top of the board and comes with a small eraser too. The board contains a couple of magnetic surfaces that are slightly recessed from the frame, so the magnets do not have a full grip of the mounting surface, but still work well.  No issues = 5 stars.

This is a typical whit board.  It does what it is supposed to do.  The included magnets are helpful.  I wish it at least came with an eraser and solution.  Even if it was just a small amount of cleaning solution, it would make it more valuable to purchase.

reviewerName: Marshall W. Carter "Ornery Gamer, Fiend Club ...
reviewText: This isn't our first Quartet Magnetic Dry Erase board. We used to have one on the fridge when our twins were born to keep track of feedings as well as to keep a running list of needs. It had a few issues, the biggest one being that the included magnets just simply weren't strong enough to keep it up. We used other magnets to "prop" it in position, but after a few slides and falls, we ended up having to get rid of it.This new Quartet Magnetic Dry erase board has all of the same issues. The build quality isn't great (plastic frame on a cardboard backing), the included marker is basically throwaway quality and the magnets still don't have the strength to keep it in position. In fact, we're using the included circle/posting magnets underneath the board in an attempt to again keep it "propped" into position.The board itself is fine, and the frame isn't unsightly, but I'm afraid that after a few more slides and falls, it too will be destined for the trashcan.
summary: Not terrible for the price, but a few things make it hard to recommend.

reviewText: The Quartet Magnetic Dry-Erase Board is advertised as being capable of being used out of the box and that claim is correct. Included with the product are self-sticking adhesive pads and dry-erase marker. Because I saw no utility of using the magnets affixed to the board (see picture), I removed them. Removing the magnets does no damage to the dry-erase board, affixed the adhesive pads, stuck it on my door and proceeded to write on it in about 15 minutes.One handy feature that is not listed is that on the tip of the dry-erase marker provided with the product is a handy eraser, which obviates the need of using a paper towel (though that will certainly work too).All in all, a great product for the cost.

This board is a nice size for jotting down quick notes; the magnets are useful too.It's a little cheap-looking, with the green plastic border.The magnet that's on the end of the included marker really isn't strong enough to hold the marker in place, so I just added my own pieces of Velcro to the cap & board to hold it more tightly.  But, the marker writes clearly & erases cleanly.

The price is cheap and so is this product. It's a small whiteboard in a plastic frame. The description said it's a calender board with a grid printed on it, so you can fill in each day of the month---however this is not the case. It's a plain whiteboard, nothing fancy.Pros:* It comes in a variety of colors. I chose green to coordinate with my sewing room and the color was exactly like I expected.* It's a magnetic whiteboard, so you can attach photos, sketches, or even business cards, and then make notes beside them.* It comes with a small dry-erase marker, so you can use the board immediately, without making an additional purchase of markers.* It comes with two large, round, clear plastic magnets, so you don't have to buy separate magnets to use the magnetic feature.Cons:* It's pretty small. Check the measurements and be sure the size is what you want, so you aren't disappointed.* The plastic frame is very cheap. There's actually a gap between the frame and the board, which increases when you apply pressure to the board---like when writing on it. I worry that the frame will eventually come loose.* The magnets it comes with are stuck to the board with a blob of sticky goo, which refused to wipe off once I removed the magnets. I had to pull out the Goo-Gone in order to clean the sticky spot off the board. (It worked nicely, but I shouldn't have to use a cleaning product to make my purchase usable.)* It doesn't have a hanger on the back, so you can't just hang it on your wall. It comes with both adhesive pads and magnets, so you can either stick it on your refrigerator (or a metal door, etc.), or you can use the adhesive squares to stick it to your wall. I don't care for either idea, personally. There is no metal surface to attach it to in my sewing room, and besides, several reviewers have stated that the magnets aren't strong enough to anchor the whiteboard in place, so it slides down. As for the adhesive squares, I'm guessing that if you use them, you can't easily move the board, and if you tried, I'm sure the adhesive would ruin the paint on the wall. This may not be the case, but I'm loathe to try it, just in case I'm right.In conclusion, this is a classic example of getting what you pay for. If you want a small, cheap whiteboard, this will serve you well. Personally, I would save my money and buy something a little higher in quality. I'll give it three stars and hesitantly recommend it, with the above-mentioned caveats.
summary: You Get What You Pay For

reviewText: What can you say about a dry erase board? It is small, which is just what I was looking for. I can't speak to how well the mounting system works because I just use it on a table next to me. I am learning machine quilting and I use this little board to practice drawing the patterns before I go to the sewing machine. The magnets work about as good as most of the other boards in this price range. The only problem I noticed was that after erasing there was a ghost image left on the board that just did not go away. No biggie as I just draw over it.

I'm a fan of dry erase boards and we've recently decided to use them more to help us organize ourselves. It was obvious that this board is a fairly cheap one right out of the package, and I do not recommend using the little eraser that comes on the dry erase marker as it does not work well.If dinged even a bit, this board shows the ding very easily, but the magnetic pieces work beautifully and it's stayed on the refrigerator perfectly, helping us to remember what groceries we need.

The white board surface is good quality. It wipes clean, without any shadowing or staining. The included marker is the perfect size for writing quick notes and has an attached eraser.Overall, I like this a lot and it is a great addition to the kitchen, but I do have two complaints: the mounting magnets are too weak, it doesn't want to stay on the fridge, it sort of slowly slides down the face of it; and, the magnets for holding notes and things are glued to the board and it is almost impossible to get all of the glue off. The residue from the glue that holds the magnets makes the surface difficult to use in that area.I only took one star off for the issues I mentioned above, because the product is otherwise perfect.

The Quartet dry-erase white board provides the practical way to make necessary notes and reminders.  With its simple green trim and size 11x 14, enough information can be written on the board with the black marker that comes with a small eraser at the tip of its cover.  But in addition to the board's basic features, it also contains adhesive stickers to hang the board on the wall and two magnets that can also be hung on a fridge or any flat surface and two separate gray-colored magnets to post papers and coupons on the front of the board.As a result of the convenient size and basic features, the white board is a helpful item to stay organized when it comes to keeping track of the daily and weekly tasks that can easily be written down and simply erased with little fuss.

I needed these for classroom math games. (Groups take turns solving the problem and hold up the board when the group is done. The first one with a right answer gets a point. Paper was making a mess like this, so I'm glad to have the little boards.)Great price too! I did not use the magnets or the stickies. I am thinking about getting one for little reminders by the door.  The magnets seem pretty strong, so I could put little notes up too. Love it!

I applied the four magnets to the double side foam spacers (which have tape on one side to secure to back of dry erase board) and put one magnet on each of the four sides of the board.  I thought this would be a great thing to put on the top freezer door or side of the refrig for a shopping list or notes.  To my great surprise the weight of the dry erase board, was enough to make it slide down the face of the refrigerator door or side.  The only way I have found to stop this is to put the top magnets at the very top of the door, and put another magnet below the dry erase board to keep it from sliding down the door.  The four magnets supplied, are not strong enough to secure the board to the refrigerator.  The refrigerator is about 4 years old, and is full size Whirlpool with a black textured finish.  Perhaps it might not slide down if the finish was completely smooth?  Most refrigerators today are made with a textured finish.  Not recommended for use on refrigerator.  Sure it would work okay if secured in another way to a wall or cabin door etc.  The plastic frame around the dry erase board looks cheap.  Made in China.
summary: Slides down Refrigerator side/door...not magnetic enough

reviewText: The Quartet Dry-Erase board is very handy for writing quick notes, shopping lists, or for your grandchild to draw to their heart's content.  It comes with 2 magnets (other magnets also work).  It also comes with 3M double sided sticky squares for mounting the board to a surface, as well as a magnetic strip that can be stuck to the back side of the board, and the board can then be stuck to a metal surface, such as a filing cabinet or refrigerator.  The sticky square method is semi-permanent, meaning you can't take it on and off, but the magnetic method allows for easy removal and replacement of the board.  The magnetic strip is strong enough to hold the board in place, but it would slip down when I tried to write on it while adhered to the refrigerator.  It is simple, though, to remove the board from the fridge, write on it, then put the board back.It also comes with a small, black dry erase marker that can be snapped into a holder at the top of the board.  This is very handy and means you won't be searching for the marker.The entire board is the size of an 8.5 x 11 piece of paper, with the writing surface about 1/2" smaller on the sides and 3/4" smaller on the top and bottom.

This dry erase board at just under $7.00 is an awesome steal.  I got the green (a little disappointed in the color, as I thought it would be a bright spring green but it is definitely an avocado green).  The board comes with a medium, black dry erase marker with an eraser on the end, two magnets and four each of 3-M brand permanent self stick mounting pads and self stick magnets with instructions for mounting.A great little dry erase board at an even greater price!
summary: Great Dry Erase Board At An Even Greater Price!

reviewText: But it works great.We've been using this steadily since it arrived, and it's hard to imagine how we got along without it before.The included marker with eraser works really well.I'm not exactly sure what the purpose of the two magnets is, but the board itself and the marker and the eraser attached to the marker make it easy to leave notes, make lists, etc.The only drawback to this product is the PERMANENT mounting adhesive included with it. I may want to move it or take it to my next apartment and the included mounting system doesn't make that easy.

I really wanted to like this Dry Erase Board but so many things were wrong with it that I couldn't.  First, I tried sticking it to my wall next to the front door with the double sided tape so that my husband, kids and I could leave messages for eachother.  It fell off the wall repeatedly.  So, I decided to use the magnets to hold it to my metal door.  It slid down the door.  Tried it on the fridge, and it slid there too.  Once I got it to finally stay where I wanted it, using a special double sided tape my husband brought from work, the marker started falling off.  Lastly, the marker started drying out within a week of using it and yes, we did put the cap on it every time so we had to buy a set of markers and leave them in a cup next to the board.  The only thing that worked well with the whole thing was that the board erased easily.

I rated Quartet Magnetic Dry-erase board 4 stars because it is a nice product. This is lightweight, magnetic, and comes in a pleasant green color that can easily be portable or placed on a wall. For now, I will not put the sticky attachments on the back because I like to take this with me and use it teaching small kids.I didn't give it 5 stars because it is not doublesided, it would be better to include another lined dry erase board on the back side.

We have several white boards in our office, and they are quite useful. I was looking forward to taking this one home and using in my home office. Well, I did, and it's pretty good. They used a rather cheap green plastic around the edges (our others are metal) and it's a bit smaller than I'm used to, but it's good for making simple notes. All in all, if you need an inexpensive white board, this is fine.

We obtained the Quartet Magnetic Dry-Erase Board for our son's dorm room. It's a great, light-weight product with a stylish look. The red border gives it a look that's set apart from the ordinary. The board (sized 8.5X11) operates as both a dry erase writing board AND a magnetic bulletin board. It can be hung either horizontally or vertically with the enclosed self-stick pads. The board also includes a dry-erase marker and two magnets allowing you to start using it immediately.I will also say that the product is pretty sturdy. It withstood the wrath of our dog, who discovered the package and tore the outer cardboard box apart. The board made it through this ordeal with only a slight tear on the backside.
summary: Great for the Board Room, Kitchen or Dorm Room

reviewText: This is a nice dry erase board. It is perfect for family communication for for a dorm or office door. It can adhere to most any surface with the included adhesive magnets or adhesive glue strips. They stick very well to not only the board to most anything you'd care to stick it to.the surface is magnetic, and includes 2 magnets and a magnetic pen with eraser. It writes smoothly and erases clean.
summary: Nice dry erase board. Magnetic, and adheres to wall

reviewText: I got this to put on my fridge for writing my grocery list on because it said 'magnetic' and I have more fridge space than wall space in my kitchen. I thought it would be a magnetic sheet with a pretty green border that would stick to my fridge. Instead it is a metal white board with a thick cardboard backing inside a plastic frame. The green is kind of a pale olive color - nice.  It also includes two round magnets in plastic to hold things onto the board and a dry-erase pen that can write on the surface.  There is a small magnet on the pen so it can stick to the board when the cheap plastic clip on top of the board breaks.In the package, the magnets are stuck to the board with sticky stuff - to get it off, I just rubbed it around with my finger until it rolled up into a sticky ball that came right off with no residue.The board comes with foam double-sided sticky pads which you must stick on the back. Then you have a choice to either stick those pads to a surface, or to stick the provided magnets on the sticky pads. I stuck the magnets on the sticky pads. Which means I had magnets on foam coming out from the back of the framed whiteboard. Rather bulky and protruding, which I don't care for.And as it happens, the magnets are not strong enough, so when I put it on my fridge it slides down, down, down until something decides to catch it, namely the controls for the ice maker. OK, I guess that works... until someone comes along and bumps it because it is sticking out!In the end, I remounted it on the back side of my pantry door - not exactly where I wanted it, but I can still jot down reminders and it isn't as likely to catch on someone's clothes.PROS:Surface is both dry-erase writable and magnets stick to itSticky foam has a strong holdCONS:Mounting magnets too weak to stick to fridgeProtrudes from whatever surface it is mounted on
summary: Protrudes, magnets too weak to stick to fridge.

reviewText: Comes with harware to hang it.  I can magnetically hang sketches, patterns, and instructions for ongoing projects yet use as a white board for notes and deadlines.  Versatile and just the right size.
summary: Great for keeping track of projects
